Package application

Class TextApplication

java.lang.Object
application.TextApplication
public class TextApplication
extends java.lang.Object
Version:
iteration 1 The class TextApplication utilizes all of the other classes (Party, Poll, PollList, and Factory) in order to form a complete text-based application. TextApplication contains a constant (the maximum number of stars) and a PollList.
Author:
Andrew

  • Field Summary

    Fields 
    Modifier and Type Field Description
    int MAX_NUMBER_OF_STARS

    Constructors

    TextApplication()
    The default constructor - takes no arguments and does nothing

    The constructor that generates a TextApplication and assigns it a PollList

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    void displayPollDataBySeat​(model.Poll aPoll, int maxNumOfSeats)
    Visualizes one poll's data Prints the poll's name Prints the stars, name, votes, and seats for each party in the poll Sorted by number of seats
    void displayPollDataByVote​(model.Poll aPoll)
    Visualizes one poll's data Prints the poll's name Prints the stars, name, votes, and seats for each party in the poll Sorted by amount of votes
    void displayPollsBySeat​(java.lang.String[] partyNames, int maxNumOfSeats)
    Visualizes all Poll objects in the polls instance variable then presents an aggregate poll that only includes the parties that have been chosen by the user.

    Visualizes all Poll objects in the polls instance variable then presents an aggregate poll that only includes the parties that have been chosen by the user.
    static void main​(java.lang.String[] args)
    The main() method simply creates a TextApplication object and calls the run() method

  • Constructor Details

    • TextApplication

      public TextApplication()
      The default constructor - takes no arguments and does nothing

    • TextApplication

      public TextApplication​(model.PollList aPollList)
      The constructor that generates a TextApplication and assigns it a PollList
      Parameters:
      aPollList - A PollList that will be assigned to TextApplication

  • Method Details

    • displayPollDataBySeat

      public void displayPollDataBySeat​(model.Poll aPoll, int maxNumOfSeats)
      Visualizes one poll's data Prints the poll's name Prints the stars, name, votes, and seats for each party in the poll Sorted by number of seats
      Parameters:
      aPoll - A Poll that will have its data visualized
      maxNumOfSeats - The total number of seats available

    • displayPollsBySeat

      public void displayPollsBySeat​(java.lang.String[] partyNames, int maxNumOfSeats)
      Visualizes all Poll objects in the polls instance variable then presents an aggregate poll that only includes the parties that have been chosen by the user. Sorted by number of seats
      Parameters:
      partyNames - An array of strings containing the names of parties to be included in the aggregate poll
      maxNumOfSeats - The total number of seats available

    • displayPollDataByVote

      public void displayPollDataByVote​(model.Poll aPoll)
      Visualizes one poll's data Prints the poll's name Prints the stars, name, votes, and seats for each party in the poll Sorted by amount of votes
      Parameters:
      aPoll - A Poll that will have its data visualized

    • displayPollsByVote

      public void displayPollsByVote​(java.lang.String[] partyNames, int maxNumOfSeats)
      Visualizes all Poll objects in the polls instance variable then presents an aggregate poll that only includes the parties that have been chosen by the user. Sorted by amount of votes
      Parameters:
      partyNames - An array of strings containing the names of parties to be included in the aggregate poll
      maxNumOfSeats - The total number of seats available

    • run

      public void run()
      Runs the entire application. Prompts the user for information Uses factory to generate random polls Creates a TextApplication object then presents the poll data

    • main

      public static void main​(java.lang.String[] args)
      The main() method simply creates a TextApplication object and calls the run() method
      Parameters:
      args - Arguments passed to the main routine
